title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.29 | 26-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to spiritual predecessors.

segments.key_quote: So Bhishma Deva was specially blessed to quit his body at the most auspicious time so that he could make his destination going back home back to Godhead
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam about Bhishma Deva's auspicious death during Uttarayana, highlighting his ability to choose the time of his departure.

segments.key_quote: The perfect Yogis or mystics can leave the material body at their own sweet will at a suitable time and go to a suitable planet desired by them
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing the yogi's ability to control their body and mind to choose their destination after death, a science not taught in modern education.

segments.key_quote: See there is a spiritual sky beyond this material sky
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the material and spiritual skies, explaining that the material world is characterized by darkness and ignorance, while the spiritual world is illuminated by Krishna's effulgence.

segments.key_quote: Darkness also means ignorance. That is a characteristic of material existence
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on ignorance as a characteristic of material existence and emphasizes the importance of Vedic scriptures as a source of enlightenment and knowledge.

segments.key_quote: Perfection of yoga means attainment of such supra mental states that means the mind is completely controlled
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the perfection of yoga, enabling one to leave the body at will and travel to other planets without material vehicles, contrasting this with the limitations of materialistic science.

segments.key_quote: So please try to understand that leaving this earth planet and going to another planet requires that we acclimatize our selves our body to the conditions prevailing there
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing planetary travel, emphasizing the need to adapt the body to different planetary conditions and reiterating that spiritual knowledge is a real science, exemplified by Bhishma Deva.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva, even though he could quit his body at any time he desired, he chose to quit his body at the auspicious time of Uttarayana Punni.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that while pure devotees don't need to wait for an auspicious time to die, Bhishma Deva waited to instruct his grandsons as desired by Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Krishna desired that Bhishma Deva instruct the Pandavas especially Yudhishthira who was aggrieved at the massacre that had taken place due to the battle of Kurukshetra to enthrone Yudhishthira as the emperor of the world.
segments.summary: The speaker details how Bhishma Deva, despite being on a bed of arrows, instructed the Pandavas on Dharma, mitigating Yudhishthira's grief, demonstrating the power of Krishna consciousness.
